definitions: A person or thing that carries, holds, or conveys something.
A person or company that undertakes the professional conveyance of goods or people.
A vessel or vehicle for transporting goods in bulk.
A company that provides facilities for conveying telecommunications messages.
A person or animal that transmits a disease-causing organism to others, especially without suffering from it themselves.

An individual that possesses a particular gene, especially as a single copy whose effect is masked by a dominant allele, so that the associated characteristic (such as a hereditary disease) is not displayed but may be passed to offspring.
A substance used to support or convey another substance such as a pigment, catalyst, or radioactive material.
A molecule that transfers a specified molecule or ion within the body, especially across a cell membrane.
